page.title: 12Shalfleet Church
page.content: The church is one of few Island churches to be recorded in the Domesday book. Its main feature is the {Norman tower}with walls 5 feet thick. There was no way in from outside. It was used as a refuge and a place defence.There is a narrow splral staircase in the North West corner of the tower built into the tower. There are 56 steps to the top. First we climbed up to the floor where the{two bells}are hung. Then we climbed up further. We climbed up a short metal ladder (it came from a railway signal box) to push the heavy trap door open. We climbed out onto the{roof}of the tower. We could see a long way. We could see the grass cutters in the fields at Homestead Farm. We looked down on the village - the old and new houses.
